'''Copper leggings''' are a variant of [[leggings]] crafted from [[copper ingot]]s. They are the sixth-highest [[tier]] of leggings, having the same armor points as [[golden leggings]] but with higher durability.

== Obtaining ==

=== Mob loot ===
[[Zombie]]s, [[husk]]s, [[skeleton]]s, [[stray]]s, and [[bogged]] have a small chance to spawn [[Geared mobs|wearing armor]], which may include copper leggings. There is a 8.5% chance (9.5% with [[Looting]] I, 10.5% with Looting II and 11.5% with Looting III) for the mob to drop the leggings they're wearing upon death. The dropped leggings are usually badly damaged, and may be [[enchanted]] with enchantment levels 5-19.

== Usage ==
When worn, copper leggings provide {{armor|3}} [[armor points]].

=== Repairing ===
==== Combining ====
Two damaged pairs of copper leggings can be combined through [[crafting]], using the [[grindstone]] or the [[anvil]]. The durability of the used copper leggings is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.

Crafting and using the grindstone do not keep the enchantments of either copper leggings.

{{Crafting|Damaged Copper Leggings|Damaged Copper Leggings

|type = Combat

}}

Using the anvil preserves enchantments, but costs [[experience]].

==== Unit repair ====
Copper leggings can also be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[copper ingot]]s, with each ingot restoring 25% the copper leggings' maximum durability, rounded down. This preserves the leggings' [[enchantment]]s, but costs [[experience]].

|description=|showdescription=1
}}

=== Armor trimming ===
It is possible to upgrade armor with trims. This requires a [[smithing template]], a copper leggings, and an ingot or crystal ([[iron ingot]], [[copper ingot]], [[gold ingot]], [[netherite ingot]], [[emerald]], [[redstone dust]], [[lapis lazuli]], [[amethyst shard]], [[nether quartz]], [[diamond]], or [[resin brick]]).

These trims have no effect on the gameplay or strength of the armor.

|ingredients=Any Armor Trim +<br>Copper Leggings +<br>Any Ingot/Crystal
